content.question: A spaceship orbits a distant planet in a circular orbit, as shown in the figure. When the spaceship reaches Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, it momentarily fires its thrusters directly toward the center of the planet, causing the spaceship’s orbit to become elliptical. The two arrows in the figure represent the spaceship’s velocity at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> for the two orbits. Consider the angular momentum <math alttext="L sub ship" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>ship</mtext></msub></math> of the spaceship about the planet’s center and the total mechanical energy <math alttext="E sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></math> of the spaceship-planet system. Which of the following identifies the quantity that will be the same for both the original circular orbit and the new elliptical orbit and provides correct reasoning for the claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="L sub ship" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>ship</mtext></msub></math> is the same. There is no torque about the center of the planet when the thrusters are fired.
<math alttext="L sub ship" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>ship</mtext></msub></math> is the same. Angular momentum is constant for all orbits, both circular and elliptical.

<math alttext="E sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></math> is the same. The point where the thrusters are fired is on both the circular and the elliptical orbit.

<math alttext="E sub system" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mtext>sys</mtext></msub></math> is the same. The thrusters are fired in a direction that does not change the translational speed of the spaceship.

content.answer: <math alttext="L sub ship" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>ship</mtext></msub></math> is the same. There is no torque about the center of the planet when the thrusters are fired.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems
